phrase.rem: sometimes used for 'four times', but 四回 is more common
appears in GENKI2 L22 vocab section

sentence.s: よし、もう【一：いち】【度：ど】やろう。
sentence.tr_en: All right, I will do it again.
sentence.tr_de: Gut, ich mache es nochmals.

sentence.s: 【京：きょう】【都：と】へはまだ【一：いち】【度：ど】も【行：い】ったことがありません。
sentence.rom: Kyōto e wa mada ichi-do mo itta koto ga arimasen.
sentence.tr_en: I have not even once been to Kyoto.
sentence.tr_de: Ich bin noch kein einziges Mal in Kyoto gewesen.

sentence.s: では、【土：ど】【曜：よう】【日：び】か【日：にち】【曜：よう】【日：び】にもう【一：いち】【度：ど】【電：でん】【話：わ】します。
sentence.rom: De wa, do-yōbi ka nichi-yōbi ni mō ichi-do denwa shimasu.
sentence.tr_en: Okay then, (I'll) call (you) again on Saturday or Sunday.
sentence.tr_de: Gut, dann (werde ich dich) am Samstag oder Sonntag nochmals anrufen.

word.rem: is now a phrase of ichi-do; jisho has n3; kept in to silence find-missing
appears in GENKI2 p.386, therefore n4; jisho has n1

sentence.s: 【紙：かみ】を【一：いち】【枚：まい】ください。
sentence.tr_en: One sheet of paper, please.
sentence.tr_de: Ein Blatt Papier, bitte.

sentence.s: シャツが【一：いち】【枚：まい】あります。
sentence.tr_en: There is one shirt.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat ein Hemd.

sentence.s: この【二：に】【枚：まい】の【葉：は】は【似：に】ている。
sentence.rom: Kono ni-mai no ha wa nite iru.
sentence.tr_en: These two leaves look alike.
sentence.tr_de: Diese zwei Blätter schauen gleich aus.

sentence.s: 【写：しゃ】【真：しん】が【四：よん】【枚：まい】あります。
sentence.tr_en: There are four photos.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat vier Fotos.

sentence.s: 【10：じゅう】【円：えん】【切：きっ】【手：て】を【五：ご】【枚：まい】【買：か】った。
sentence.tr_en: I bought five 10-yen stamps.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe fünf Zehn-Yen-Briefmarken gekauft.

word.rem: just to provide the reading for the furigana check of sentences

phrase.rem: also appears in GENKI2 L20 vocab section; jisho has n1 for kai

phrase.ph: 【二：に】【階：かい】【建：だ】ての【家：いえ】
phrase.rem: verified with ChatGPT; storeys and storeyed is correct in British English

phrase.ph: 【三：さん】【階：がい】【建：だ】ての【家：いえ】
【六：ろっ】【階：かい】【建：だ】ての【家：いえ】
【八：はっ】【階：かい】【建：だ】ての【家：いえ】
【十：じゅっ】【階：かい】【建：だ】ての【家：いえ】

sentence.s: お【手：て】【洗：あら】いは【二：に】【階：かい】にございます。
sentence.tr_en: The lavatory is on the second floor.
sentence.tr_de: Die Toilette ist auf dem zweiten Stock.

sentence.s: エレベーターを【使：つか】って【三：さん】【階：がい】に【行：い】ってください。
sentence.rom: Erebētā o tsukatte sangai ni itte kudasai.
sentence.tr_en: Please use the lift to get to the third floor.
sentence.tr_de: Bitte verwenden Sie den Lift, um auf die dritte Etage zu gelangen.

sentence.s: この【家：いえ】は【四：よん】【階：かい】【建：だ】てです。
sentence.rom: Kono ie wa yon-kai date desu.
sentence.tr_en: This house is four-storied.
sentence.tr_de: Dieses Haus ist vierstöckig.

sentence.s: 【高：たか】【木：ぎ】さんの【事：じ】【務：む】【所：しょ】は【何：なん】【階：がい】ですか。
sentence.rom: Takagi-san no jimusho wa nangai desu ka?
sentence.tr_en: What floor is Mr Takagi's office on?
sentence.tr_de: Auf welcher Etage ist Herrn Takagis Büro?

sentence.s: 【高：たか】【木：ぎ】さんの【事：じ】【務：む】【所：しょ】は【六：ろっ】【階：かい】にございます。
sentence.rom: Takagi-san no jimusho wa rokkai ni gozaimasu.
sentence.tr_en: Mr Takagi's office is on the sixth floor.
sentence.tr_de: Herr Takagis Büro ist im sechsten Stock.

word.rem: just to provide the reading for the furigana check of sentences
just to provide the reading for the furigana check of sentences
appears in GENKI2 p.387, therefore n4; jisho has n1

phrase.rem: see GENKI2 p.387; also pronounced jissatsu

sentence.s: 【私：わたし】は【日：に】【本：ほん】【語：ご】の【本：ほん】を【一：いっ】【冊：さつ】しか【持：も】っていません。
sentence.rom: Watashi wa Nihon-go no hon o issatsu shika motte imasen.
sentence.tr_en: I have only one Japanese book.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe nur ein einziges japanisches Buch.
sentence.explanation_en: しか + negative form has the meaning of 'only'
sentence.explanation_de: しか + negative Form hat die Bedeutung von 'nur'

sentence.s: 【辞：じ】【書：しょ】が【二：に】【冊：さつ】あるから【一：いっ】【冊：さつ】【貸：か】してあげる。
sentence.rom: Jisho ga ni-satsu aru kara issatsu kashite ageru.
sentence.tr_en: I've got two dictionaries, I'll lend you one.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe zwei Wörterbücher, ich leih dir eines.

sentence.s: 【雑：ざっ】【誌：し】が【三：さん】【冊：さつ】あります。
sentence.tr_en: There are three magazines.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat drei Zeitschriften.

sentence.s: 【本：ほん】を【四：よん】【冊：さつ】【買：か】った。
sentence.tr_en: I bought four books.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe vier Bücher gekauft.

sentence.s: 【机：つくえ】の【上：うえ】に【本：ほん】が【八：はっ】【冊：さつ】ある。
sentence.rom: Tsukue no ue ni hon ga hassatsu aru.
sentence.tr_en: There are eight books on the desk.
sentence.tr_de: Auf dem Schreibtisch hat es acht Bücher.

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.69, therefore n4; jisho has n3

sentence.s: ラジオが【一：いち】【台：だい】あります。
sentence.tr_en: There is one radio.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat ein Radio.

sentence.s: この【会：かい】【社：しゃ】にはパソコンが【二：に】【台：だい】しかありません。
sentence.rom: Kono kaisha ni wa pasokon ga ni-dai shika arimasen.
sentence.tr_en: There are only two computers in this company.
sentence.tr_de: In dieser Firma gibt es gerade mal zwei Computer.
sentence.explanation_en: しか + negative form has the meaning of 'only'
sentence.explanation_de: しか + negative Form hat die Bedeutung von 'nur'

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.386, therefore n4; jisho has n1

sentence.s: 【猫：ねこ】が【二：に】【匹：ひき】います。
sentence.tr_en: There are two cats.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat zwei Katzen.

sentence.s: 【私：わたし】のうちには【猫：ねこ】が【三：さん】【匹：びき】います。
sentence.rom: Watashi no uchi ni wa neko ga sanbiki imasu.
sentence.tr_en: There are three cats in our house.
sentence.tr_de: Wir haben drei Katzen zu Hause.

sentence.s: 【魚：さかな】が【五：ご】【匹：ひき】います。
sentence.tr_en: There are five fish.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat drei Fische.

sentence.s: 【魚：さかな】を【八：はっ】【匹：ぴき】【釣：つ】った。
sentence.tr_en: I caught eight fish.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe acht Fische gefangen.

word.tr_en: counter for pairs of shoes or socks
word.tr_de: Zählwort für Paare von Schuhen oder Socken

phrase.tr_en: how many pairs (of shoes or socks)

sentence.s: 【祖：そ】【母：ぼ】が【靴：くつ】【下：した】を【八：はっ】【足：そく】くれた。
sentence.rom: Sobo ga kutsushita o hassoku kureta.
sentence.tr_en: My grandmother gave me eight pairs of socks.
sentence.tr_de: Meine Grossmutter hat mir acht Paar Socken geschenkt.

sentence.s: 【三：さん】【足：ぞく】の【山：さん】【賊：ぞく】は【靴：くつ】【下：した】を【三：さん】【足：ぞく】【盗：ぬす】んだ。
sentence.rom: Sanzoku no sanzoku wa kutsushita o sanzoku nusunda.
sentence.tr_en: The three-legged bandit stole three pairs of socks.
sentence.tr_de: Der dreibeinige Bandit stahl drei Paar Socken.
sentence.rem: verified with ChatGPT; 山賊 is nx

word.rem: see GENKI2 p.387; jisho has n1

sentence.s: メールを【一：いっ】【通：つう】も【受：う】けなかった。
sentence.tr_en: I didn't receive even a single e-mail.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe nicht mal ein E-Mail erhalten.

sentence.s: 【今朝：けさ】、【手：て】【紙：がみ】を【八：はっ】【通：つう】も【書：か】いた。
sentence.rom: Kesa, tegami o hattsū mo kaita.
sentence.tr_en: I have written as many as eight letters this morning.
sentence.tr_de: Heute Morgen habe ich ganze acht Briefe geschrieben.

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.69, therefore n4; jisho has n1

sentence.s: パンを【一：いっ】【個：こ】【買：か】った。
sentence.tr_en: I bought one loaf of bread.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe ein Laib Brot gekauft.

sentence.s: ミカンが【二：に】【個：こ】あります。
sentence.tr_en: There are two mandarines.
sentence.tr_de: Es hat zwei Mandarinen.

sentence.s: ケーキを【８：はっ】【個：こ】【焼：や】いた。
sentence.tr_en: I baked eight cakes.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe acht Kuchen gebacken.

sentence.s: 【荷：に】【物：もつ】は【何：なん】【個：こ】ですか。
sentence.tr_en: How many bags (do you have)?
sentence.tr_de: Wieviele Gepäckstücke (haben Sie)?

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.387; jisho has n1

sentence.s: 【三：さん】【丁：ちょう】【目：め】の【古：ふる】い【喫：きっ】【茶：さ】【店：てん】によく【通：かよ】っていた。
sentence.rom: San-chōme no furui kissaten ni yoku kayotte ita.
sentence.tr_en: I often visited an old café in the third street.
sentence.tr_de: Ich besuchte oft das alte Café in der achten Strasse.

sentence.s: 【八：はっ】【丁：ちょう】【目：め】の【交：こう】【差：さ】【点：てん】を【右：みぎ】に【曲：ま】がってください。
sentence.rom: Hacchōme no kōsaten o migi ni magatte kudasai.
sentence.tr_en: Please turn right at the intersection in the 8th block.
sentence.tr_de: Bitte biege bei der Kreuzung im achten Block nach rechts ab.

phrase.tr_en: how many cupfuls; how many portions

sentence.s: 【茶：ちゃ】が【一：いっ】【杯：ぱい】ほしい。
sentence.tr_en: I want one cup of tea.
sentence.tr_de: Ich will eine Tasse Tee.

sentence.s: もう【一：いっ】【杯：ぱい】いかがですか。
sentence.tr_en: Would you like another serving?
sentence.tr_de: Möchten Sie eine weitere Portion?

sentence.s: 【昨日：きのう】のパーティーでビールを【七：なな】【杯：はい】も【飲：の】んでしまった。
sentence.rom: Kinō no pātī de bīru o nana-hai mo nonde shimatta.
sentence.tr_en: I ended up drinking as many as seven beers at yesterday’s party.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe gestern an der Party ganze sieben Biere getrunken.
sentence.rem: GENKI2 table has nana-hai, but ChatGPT says shichi-hai is more common

word.rem: just to provide the reading for the furigana check of sentences
